title: Lower Yoke and Headstock Bearings - Installation

body.body: Lower Yoke and Headstock Bearings - Installation
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Fit a new dust seal to the steering stem on the lower yoke as noted for removal. Lubricate the seal’s knife-edge using Castrol LCX 222 or an equivalent heavy duty lithium based grease.
Protect the threads of the lower yoke when using a press or puller as damaged threads may mean replacing the yoke completely.
Press a new lower bearing inner race onto the steering stem of the lower yoke.
Install the bearing onto the lower yoke.
Evenly and progressively drive a new bearing outer races into the frame headstock.
Lubricate the lower bearing using Castrol LCX 222 or an equivalent heavy duty lithium based grease.
Insert the lower yoke to the frame, fit the upper bearing, inner race, dust seal and retain with the adjuster nut.
Check that no free play exists in the headstock bearings. Adjust as necessary

Move the handlebars to left and right full lock while checking that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A hose, cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.

Check for correct operation of the front brake, clutch and twist grip. Check that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or restrict the steering when the handlebars are turned from lock-to-lock. Rectify as necessary.
